title: Critical Incident reports for shelter suicide in Queens Dec 14

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Critical Incident reports for shelter suicide in Queens Dec 14
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I'm writing to obtain a copy of the critical incident report from New York City regarding a suicide in on December 14 in Queens.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gwynne Hogan

title: Virginia Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

title: Massachusetts DYS Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massachusetts DYS Youth Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

title: Phone and visit policies at DYS Middleton - Northeast Regional Youth Service Center and other NE regional programs

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Phone and visit policies at DYS Middleton - Northeast Regional Youth Service Center and other NE regional programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Current policies, rules and practices related to access to make outgoing and receive incoming telephone calls that apply to youth at DYS Middleton - Northeast Regional Youth Service Center and for other facilities and programs in the DYS Northeast region, including sub-contractors, including Strive and Bright Futures.  This includes youth access to facility phones and to personal cell phones. It also includes who they can call and how that is determined, and frequency and duration of calls allowed.

2. Current policies, rules and practices related to in-person visits, both frequency and duration, that apply to youth at DYS Middleton - Northeast Regional Youth Service Center and other facilities and programs in the DYS Northeast region, including sub-contractors, including Strive and Bright Futures. This includes who can visit and how that is determined. This also includes any access to video visits.

3. Any additional information relevant to assessing whether DYS Northeast Region phone and visiting policies are in fact significantly more limiting and restrictive than all Massachusetts jails and prisons and the impact this has on teenagers trying to maintain and build strong relationships with family and loved ones.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Betsey Chace

title: Michael P.W. Stone

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Michael P.W. Stone
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Michael Patrick William Stone (June 2, 1925 – May 18, 1995), who served as Secretary of the Army from 1989 to 1993. Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/1995/05/20/obituaries/michael-p-w-stone-69-army-secretary-in-bush-administration.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This search is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Joe/Hunter Biden Email Records
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Schaeffer:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
foia@nara.gov.  We received your request on December 19, 2022.  Your
request concerns *a**ny and all records containing the email messages to
and from the President Joseph Robinette Biden and his son Robert Hunter
Biden detailing dealings with Ukraine - Burisma firms.*

Our office uses the foia@nara.gov email address for FOIA and Privacy Act
requests for NARA's operational records (records created by this
agency).  Because you are requesting records of Vice-President *Biden*, we
are forwarding your request by this email to the Archival Operations
Division at our Washington, DC facility, which handles requests for such
records.

The division will assign your request a tracking number and respond
directly to you.  In the future, if you need to contact that office, you
may do so at the address below, or electronically via email (email is
preferred).

Archival Operations Division (LA)
National Archives and Records Administration
700 Pennsylvania Ave., NW, Room G-7
Washington, DC 20408
Email:  presidential.materials@nara.gov  <presidential.materials@nara.gov>

For your reference, a copy of your request is below.

Please visit our website at www.archives.gov/foia for further information
about submitting a FOIA request to NARA.  On our main website,
www.archives.gov, you can learn more about the resources we offer to the
public, and you can access our online catalog.  For information about the
Presidential Records Act (PRA) which covers presidential records (and
vice-presidential records) from the Reagan administration and later, please
see https://www.archives.gov/about/laws/presidential-records.html#2204 .

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and pursuant to guidance received from the
Office of Management and Budget (OMB), NARA had adjusted its normal
operations to balance the need of completing its mission-critical work
while also adhering to the recommended social distancing for the safety of
our staff.  As a result of this re-prioritization of activities, you may
experience a delay in receiving a substantive response to your request.  We
apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your understanding and
patience.

Sincerely,
Ashley A. Bryan
Government Information Specialist
Office of General Counsel (NGC)
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001
301-837-3642

title: GoGuardian - Lists, Alerts

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: GoGuardian - Lists, Alerts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records related to the school district's use of GoGuardian technology:

1) A list of all website names,  URLs and keywords that are blacklisted/blocked by the district's GoGuardian web-filtering software.
2) A list of all website names,  URLs and keywords that the district has manually whitelisted/allowed access to upon request through the GoGuardian web-filtering software.

Please note that items 1 and 2 are usually available through an Excel file called GoGuardian_Filters.xlsx. We have received this information from other schools in this format. 

3) All alerts generated by GoGuardian software from January 1, 2020 through November 18, 2022. Please redact any identifying information. This includes the following types of alert documents, usually available as Excel files:
a. Beacon
b. Flagged activity
c. Smart alerts
d. Policy export 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

title: FOIA Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer:
 
This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act requesting copies of all records, including video, audio, emails, texts, and other similar documents, whether sent from or received on official or personal equipment in relation to the shooting of 31-year-old Londre Sylvester on July 9, 2021 Saturday 9 pm near Cook County Jail. He was shot 64 times in the parking lot.
 
This request includes but is not limited to the following: missing persons report, any crime scene photos/videos, 911 calls, cell phone video, case files, incident reports, police reports, interrogation videos/audio, autopsy reports, missing person report, police interrogation video for other people involved in the shootout, and police video of arrests, copies of any POD Camera video, video or photo surveillance, and any associated documentation.

I am a producer with Vice News, this request is made for the purpose of news gathering and not for commercial use.
 
I request a waiver of all fees since this request is being made in the interest of the public and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations and activities related to this former public official’s activities. 
 
I request an expedited processing of this request as this information provides great value to public interest and thus is time sensitive. 
 
Sincerely,
Rafa Farihah, 
Vice News, Associate Producer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Solorio

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT - Verification of reduced administrative staff in 2022
communications.communication:
EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT - Verification of reduced administrative staff in 2022

12-16-22

via email to: public.records@eatonville.wednet.edu

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS - ALL ELECTRONIC MAIL (E-MAIL), ELECTRONIC TEXTS, and ELECTRONIC RECORDS referencing the following subjects/or topics for the period of time between January 1, 2022 - December 16,2022:

Reduced Staff, Reduction in staff, administrative Staff reductions, retirements, layoffs, firings, open positions, full head count, reduced head count, delays due to reduced staff, and any records regarding full or reduced administrative staffing for your agency in 2022.

Please include  in any reasonable search for responsive records a search of the following email accounts:

GARY NEAL - SUPERINTENDENT - g.neal@eatonville.wednet.edu
KIMBERLY HENLEY - EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT - k.henley@eatonville.wednet.edu
LINDSAY FITZER - HR & PAYROLL SPECIALIST - l.fitzer@eatonville.wednet.edu
CAROLYN CAMERON - ACCOUNTS PAYABLE - c.cameron@eatonville.wednet.edu
KALINDA LEWIS - HR COORDINATOR - k.lewis@eatonville.wednet.edu
AMANDA SMITH - EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT - a.m.smith@eatonville.wednet.edu
TERESA ROLFE - HUMAN RESOURCE ASSISTANT & SKYWARD - t.rolfe@eatonville.wednet.edu
PAMELA STRUB - PAYROLL & BENEFITS - p.strub@eatonville.wednet.edu


With respect to requests for records that include "communications," I am requesting all emails, text messages, and electronic records, regardless the type of device or account from which the communication was generated or where the device or data is stored (including personal devices such as personal cell phones, laptops, tablets, and/or computers etc. used from home to conduct public business during the COVID-19 Pandemic). Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

With respect to requests for records that include "Writings" per 42.56.010(4) this means handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, via e-mail attachment format or unprotected internet cloud link if possible, or on USB FLASH DRIVE or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Fare Evasion Prevention Statistics

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Fare Evasion Prevention Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Amount of billable hours the MTPD has patrolled the Metro system in which fare evasion was part of the shift duties. Weekly or monthly reports over 2018-2022 are ideal.
-Itemized expense report of each fare-evasion prevention project from 2018-2022
-reports relating to the effectiveness of said fare-evasion projects from 2018-2022
-Reports relating to future plans of fare-evasion policing and projected expenses of fare-evasion prevention tactics from 2018-2022

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an affiliate of HIPS DC and will be using this information for internal analysis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Colby

communications.subject: Acknowledgement letter 2023-FOIA-01973
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Colby, This e-mail is toacknowledge receipt of your FOIA request assigned: 2023-FOIA-01973.Your assigned FOIA Specialist is: LisaArchie-Mills. If you have any questions regarding your request, please contact yourassigned FOIA Specialist who is included in this e-mail.  Be advised, ouroffice has a hybrid onsite/remote work schedule.  Therefore, if you areunable to reach your specialist when calling our office, please make contactvia e-mail.  For ease of reference, we ask that you have your FOIA RequestNumber available when you contact our office. Once the requested documents arereceived, please be advised of the following notations below: RESPONSE TIME Pu rsuant to D.C. Official Code §2-532(c),  there is a 15 business day statutory allotted time, subject tothe possibility of a ten (10) business day extension from the date of receiptto respond to a FOIA request.  If your request is for Body Worn Camera (BWC) footage, there is a25 business day statutory allotted time, subject to the possibility of 15working-day extension from the date of receipt to respond to a Body Worn Camera (BWC) request. REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED SERVICE If you seek expedited service relating to your FOIA request,please be advised, there is no provision or authority under the District ofColumbia Freedom of Information Act laws, to provide expedited service. Therefore, your request will be processed under the provision of the D.C.Official Code §§ 2-531 et seq. Regards,  LatrinaCrumlin 
StaffAssistant 
300Indiana Ave NW RM 4153 
Washington,DC 20001

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all information provided by the Environmental Protection Agency to Joanna McCall in response to FOIA public records request EPA-R9-2021-000592 described at https://foiaonline.gov/foiaonline/action/public/submissionDetails?trackingNumber=EPA-R9-2021-000592&type=Request

Please include any and all Environmental Protection Agency warning letters regarding the Lead-Based Paint Disclosure Rule, related to the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland California 94606.

Please include any and all Environmental Protection Agency warning letters regarding the Lead Renovation, Repair and Painting Rule, related to the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland California 94606.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Anders Maxdale

title: Port Authority Bus Terminal Entry/Exit (The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey)
tags: port authority of new york new jersey

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Port Authority Bus Terminal Entry/Exit (The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any policies, procedures, protocols, memos, directives, and/or guidelines concerning the use of barrier devices (e.g. gates, chains, ropes, fencing, or similar) within the Port Authority Bus Terminal and/or the 42nd Street Subway station complex.
Any policies, procedures, protocols, memos, directives, and/or guidelines concerning limiting access between the Port Authority Bus Terminal and its points of entry (e.g. the use of door locks or barrier devices), including at the street-level and at the Subway-level.
Any policies, procedures, protocols, memos, directives, guidelines, schedules, maintenance records, and/or work orders concerning the maintenance of doors between the Port Authority Bus Terminal and its points of entry, including street-level doors and Subway-level doors.
Within the last 5 years: Any invoices, contracts, statements of work and/or reports concerning the installation, maintenance, repair, and/or replacement of doors between the Port Authority Bus Terminal and its points of entry, including street-level doors and Subway-level doors.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Henner

title: Lead contamination pictures (Oakland Planning & Building Dept.)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Lead contamination pictures (Oakland Planning & Building Dept.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting copies of all photographs related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

Specifically requesting copies of all photographs related to the 2019 lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, owned by Donald and Era Farnsworth of Oakland California, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

Release of the following records, photographs or documents is requested:

1) Requesting copies of all photographs sent as an email attachment to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released an electronic document named RSchimm_Emails_Redacted.pdf, containing an email sent to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The email of October 8, 2019 describes lead contaminated conditions at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, after uncontained power sanding of lead based paint was performed. The email of October 8, 2019 states "Dust is spreading, tenants and neighbors don't know. None of the tenants have received pamphlets", "Dust has escaped the work area to tenants and neighbors space" and "Pictures are enclosed." Release of all pictures referenced within or attached to the email of October 8, 2019 is requested. 

2) Requesting copies of all photographs sent as an email attachment to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Monday, November 4, 2019 , with the Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Case # 19045.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released an electronic document named RSchimm_Emails_Redacted.pdf, containing an email sent to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Monday, November 4, 2019, with the Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Case # 19045.

The email of November 4, 2019 describes concerns over unsafe lead-based work practices at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606. The email of November 4, 2019 states "contamination of new areas", "area left covered with dust, chips and a dirty work glove for the entire weekend", "Waste was not secured in a locked area, bags are covered with dust" and "Pictures are attached." Release of all pictures referenced within or attached to the email of November 4, 2019 is requested. 

3) Requesting copies of all photographs taken on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, at the onsite inspection performed by City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606.

In response to public records request #19-6316 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/19-6316 the City of Oakland released a
Record Detail with Inspection Log related to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The Inspection Log contains notes related to the onsite inspection performed by City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606. The inspection log states "photos taken, violation verified. Lead based paint being ground off the building without proper containment methods" and "Paint chips, dust and debris being scattered all over site". Release of all photographs taken at the October 8, 2019 onsite inspection at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563, is requested.

4) Requesting copies of all additional photographs related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563, which depict the lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, owned by Donald and Era Farnsworth of Oakland California. Additionally requesting copies of all additional photographs which depict the lead contamination of properties neighboring the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released a Notice of Violation, Stop Work Order, and eight photographs accompanying the documents, related to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The Stop Work Order dated October 8, 2019 describes "Hazardous lead based paint removal and contamination of local area & beyond." The Notice of Violation dated October 12, 2019 describes "Lead based paint debris being contaminating soil and side of building." and "causing lead based paint to contaminate neighboring properties and soil". Requesting release of all photographs which depict the lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563. Additionally requesting copies of all photographs which depict the lead contamination of properties neighboring the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anders Maxdale
